channel.title: JRPGs
channel.description:
There have been various Japanese Role-Playing video games that have been around. List the ones that you once played before or known.
So far, the best one in my opinion is Final Fantasy 7.

item.dc:creator: Charchar
item.description:
Piracy, haha…

Yes download them all, torrent the Orange box, sell and earn money with the Black Mesa Mod when it’s released

Actually, if I lived in USA or Europe, I’d buy games…But I don’t, so, nah

Read full topic

item.title: JRPGs
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Chrono Trigger, FFX, and Tales of Symphonia 1 are my favorites. I tried Tales of the Abyss and Tales of Vesperia but I couldn’t get into them. I think the Tales games are too similar, so you can play one and its fun but then playing another one feels boring. Guess the same could be said of FF but I haven’t played many of those.

Read full topic

item.title: JRPGs
item.dc:creator: Daedalus
item.description:
JohnKiller118:

No.
Personally, I love ROMS. I played the original Metal Gears using blueMSX.
I just hate it when people pirate recent releases and make up shitty excuses like “i hav no moniez” or “it sux but i want to play it lol.”
If you don’t want to buy it, that’s fine. It’s your right as a consumer to decide on your purchasing decisions. But you have no right to play it otherwise and any excuse against this statement is retarded.

:FFFUUU:

Read full topic

item.description:
wheybags:

Ok, ok, geez, I don’t really want to start this again.
But at least tell me you wouldn’t get moralfaggy over fan-tran roms.

No.
Personally, I love ROMS. I played the original Metal Gears using blueMSX.
I just hate it when people pirate recent releases and make up shitty excuses like “i hav no moniez” or “it sux but i want to play it lol.”
If you don’t want to buy it, that’s fine. It’s your right as a consumer to decide on your purchasing decisions. But you have no right to play it otherwise and any excuse against this statement is retarded.

item.title: JRPGs

item.description:
JohnKiller118:

Would you like it if I stole your hard work that you were going to keep to yourself because Nintendo of America has a fear of magical transvestites, copyright infringement and profit loss?

Yes.

item.title: JRPGs
item.dc:creator: Daedalus
item.description:
Doom:

IX is best no matter you say… oh damn.

I think I gotta agree. FFIX just has a certain charm about it that no other FF has been able to capture for me. I really love the shit out of that game.
Maybe it’s cause it’s the first FF I ever played.

I’ve also played FFV, VI, VII, VIII, X and XII and Crisis Core
Avid FF fan here.

Also a fan of some other JRPG’s though. Tales of Symphonia for instance. Golden Sun.

Read full topic

item.title: JRPGs
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
Hey, don’t mock the universal truth of “stealing is bad.”
Would you like it if I stole your hard work that you were going to use to sell and feed yourself? Just because I wasn’t sure if your work is a quality product and too lazy to do any research like reviews and gameplay videos/didn’t have any money?

item.title: JRPGs
item.dc:creator: Codgin
item.description:
been a while since i played a jrpg as you called it, alot of them prove to be very repetive and boring the key to 'em is a good story. FF4 (Soley because every hour someone scarficed themselves, was funny but very irrating), 8 and 9 are amongst my favourites, I know many will disagree but I really enjoyed them. Another one that hit me by suprise was a suprinsgly cheap game on the PSX, where you had guaridan pet monsters, it was like pokemon but cheaper but better if that makes sense… Oh and Grandia was good if not a little boring at time

My favourite was FF7 (No suprise and as boring as that it is) and Chrono Trigger

Read full topic

item.title: JRPGs
item.dc:creator: Charchar
item.description:
Ohh Grandia 2, such a nice game, surprisingly also avaliable for PC…Way too good action rpg

You have the YS games…there’s a whole saga, avaliable for PC, with their respective english patches…

Breath of Fire 4 for PC (no emulator)

Hmmm…Ahhhhh…The old and great Septerra Core

And the final fantasy’s, of course

Read full topic
